title: Get API keys
text: context literature review, needs low request rate quota, need key use PubMed API. info : https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/tools/developers/

title: Get API keys
text: Access Elsevier developer portal : https://dev.elsevier.com/ Click “want API key” Sign institutional/organisation credentials Click “Create API key” Enter label API key (avoid use spaces name) don’t need provide website URL Read API Service Agreement Tick “agree API Service Agreement” Read text data mining provisions Tick “agree TDM Provisions” Click “Submit” redirected “API Key” find API key

title: Get API keys
text: Access Clarivate developer portal : https://developer.clarivate.com/ Click log already member, sign using institutional/organisation credentials Click “Applications” top page Enter application ID (avoid use spaces name) Enter application name Enter application description explain use API (e.g., running systematic review dog vaccine) Choose client type “Confidential: Server side application, can keep secrets confidential tick “application use OAuth2.0 Flows (Client Credentials flow, .e. using redirects)” Click “Register application” Click “APIs” top page Select tile “Web Science API Expanded” bottom page click “Subscribe” need wait Clarivate approve application provide individual API key (can take several days weeks, hesitate contact Clarivate support team updates ts.support.anz@clarivate.com)

title: LitFetchR (Tutorial)
text: strongly recommend create new R directory individual review project. RStudio: File > New Project… > New Directory new directory, install package R GitHub: load package:
code: #This step can be skipped if `LitFetchR` is already installed devtools::install_github("thomasdumond/LitFetchR") library(LitFetchR)

title: LitFetchR (Tutorial)
text: Save API keys personal R environment: allow LitFetchR locally access personal API keys keeping confidential need share code collaborators.
code: #This step can be skipped if your API keys have already been saved. Repeat this step if your API keys changed. save_api_keys(WOS_API_KEY = "your-wos-api-key", SCP_API_KEY = "your-scp-api-key")

title: LitFetchR (Tutorial)
text: interactive create_save_search() function guide workflow. example see: using create_save_search(), two new files appear directory: search_list.txt file contains name search string saved using create_save_search(). essential file retrieve reference later. modify search string file, modified search string used future reference retrieval. history_search.xlsx file contains search run using function create_save_search(). time run function, creates new sheet named current date saves search string sent literature platforms, number results returned. already validated review search string, use create_save_search() save search string setup file required continue toward automation reference retrieval.

title: LitFetchR (Tutorial)
text: automated reference retrieval uses either Windows Task Scheduler Cron (Mac/Linux). specify , LitFetchR detect system setup task using following: running auto_LitFetchR_setup() first time, four new files created: history_id.xlsx file contains databases unique identifiers (e.g. PMID SCOPUS_ID). saved used reference retrieval extract references retrieved . history_dedup_YYYY_MM_HHMMSS.xlsx file contains history steps deduplication, using package ASySD. citationsCSV_YYYY_MM_HHMMSS.CSV file contains unique list references retrieved search conducted date referenced name file. CSV file, ready imported screening tool choice reference manager. auto_LitFetchR_code(READ_ONLY).R file contains code automatically run scheduled task. set “READ ” avoid accidental modification impair scheduled task action. deleted file accident, use auto_LitFetchR_setup() create new task new code file. time auto_LitFetchR_setup() runs, new unique history_dedup_ citationCSV_ files created history_id updated. Congratulations ! automated reference retrieval ready work ! See also: Remove change scheduled task Manual reference retrieval
code: #We recommend using a single word for the *task_ID* or to use underscores "_" to separate words. #The retrieval frequency is currently available "DAILY", "WEEKLY" or "MONTHLY". #You need to use a 24H format for the time of reference retrieval. #If you do not have an API key for WOS and/or SCP or want to exclude any database, #change "TRUE" to "FALSE" in front of the corresponding database (e.g.`WOS = FALSE`).  auto_LitFetchR_setup(task_ID = "name_of_your_task", when = "DAILY", time = "14:00", WOS = TRUE, SCP = TRUE, PMD = TRUE)

title: Manual reference retrieval
text: individual review R directory, load LitFetchR:

title: Manual reference retrieval
text: Make sure save search string using create_save_search() following function need access file search_list.txt, see LitFetchR (Tutorial). running manual_fetch(), new unique history_dedup_ citationCSV_ files created history_id updated.
code: manual_fetch(WOS = TRUE, SCP = TRUE, PMD = TRUE)

what: Automatically fetching references metadata from databases
title: Automatically fetching references metadata from databases

title: Automatically fetching references metadata from databases
text: package uses API access Web Science Scopus platforms. enjoy full performance LitFetchR, request personal API keys platforms. information API keys, can see API tutorial. affiliated University suggest contacting local librarian discuss use API keys (.e. quota access, detail databases accessed Web Science). PubMed require API key access, package can still used access PubMed . databases considered inclusion future versions package.

what: Automating the retrieval of references based on a saved search string — auto_LitFetchR_setup
title: Automating the retrieval of references based on a saved search string — auto_LitFetchR_setup
text: auto_LitFetchR_setup creates read-Rscript task run code automatically specified frequency time, three platforms (e.g. Web Science, Scopus PubMed)

title: Automating the retrieval of references based on a saved search string — auto_LitFetchR_setup
code: auto_LitFetchR_setup(   task_ID = "task_ID",   when = "DAILY",   time = "08:00",   WOS = TRUE,   SCP = TRUE,   PMD = TRUE )

title: Automating the retrieval of references based on a saved search string — auto_LitFetchR_setup
text: task_ID Name automated task (e.g. one keyword describing review) Frequency fetching, .e. DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY time Time fetching, .e. HH:MM 24-hour clock format WOS Choose search Web Science SCP Choose search Scopus PMD Choose search PubMed
